hints.title: U(1) Fitness Noether Current (Rigorous Derivation)
hints.content:
447: :label: thm-u1-noether-current
448: 
449: The global U(1)_fitness symmetry implies a conserved fitness current on the Fractal Set.
450: 
451: **1. Current Definition:**
452: 
453: For each node $n_{i,t}$ (walker $i$ at time $t$), define the **fitness 4-current**:
454: 
455: $$
456: J_{\text{fitness}}^\mu(n_{i,t}) := \rho_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t}) \cdot u^\mu(n_{i,t})
457: $$
458: 
459: where:
460: - $\rho_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t}) := \Phi(x_i(t)) \cdot s(n_{i,t})$: fitness charge density
461: - $u^\mu = (\gamma^{-1}, v^k)$: 4-velocity with $\gamma = (1 - v^2)^{-1/2}$ (in units where $c=1$)
462: - $\Phi(x) = -U(x) + \beta r(x)$: fitness function
463: - $s \in \{0,1\}$: survival status
464: 
465: **Components:**
466: - Temporal: $J^0_{\text{fitness}} = \rho_{\text{fitness}} / \gamma \approx \rho_{\text{fitness}}$ (non-relativistic)
467: - Spatial: $J^k_{\text{fitness}} = \rho_{\text{fitness}} \cdot v^k$
468: 
469: **2. Discrete Continuity Equation:**
470: 
471: The current satisfies:
472: 
473: $$
474: \frac{J^0_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t+1}) - J^0_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t})}{\Delta t} + \sum_{k=1}^d \partial_k J^k_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t}) = \mathcal{S}_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t})
475: $$
476: 
477: where $\mathcal{S}_{\text{fitness}}$ is the source term from cloning events.
478: 
479: **3. Global Conservation:**
480: 
481: Summing over all alive walkers $i \in A_t$:
482: 
483: $$
484: \frac{d}{dt} Q_{\text{fitness}}(t) = \sum_{i \in A_t} \mathcal{S}_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t})
485: $$
486: 
487: where:
488: 
489: $$
490: Q_{\text{fitness}}(t) := \sum_{i \in A_t} \Phi(x_i(t))
491: $$
492: 
493: is the total fitness charge.
494: 
495: **Between cloning events** ($\mathcal{S}_{\text{fitness}} = 0$), the total fitness charge is conserved:
496: 
497: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-59
hints.content:
501: 
502: :::{prf:proof}
503: We derive the discrete continuity equation from the stochastic update rules.
504: 
505: **Step 1: Discrete time evolution of total charge.**
506: 
507: The total fitness charge at time $t$ is:
508: 
509: $$
510: Q(t) = \sum_{i \in A_t} \Phi(x_i(t))
511: $$
512: 
513: At time $t + \Delta t$, after the Adaptive Gas update:
514: 
515: $$
516: Q(t + \Delta t) = \sum_{i \in A_{t+\Delta t}} \Phi(x_i(t + \Delta t))
517: $$
518: 
519: The change is:
520: 
521: $$
522: \Delta Q = Q(t + \Delta t) - Q(t) = \sum_{i \in A_{t+\Delta t}} \Phi(x_i(t+\Delta t)) - \sum_{i \in A_t} \Phi(x_i(t))
523: $$
524: 
525: **Step 2: Decompose into contributions.**
526: 
527: Each walker evolves via the Adaptive Gas SDE ({prf:ref}`def-hybrid-sde` in {doc}`07_adaptative_gas.md`):
528: 
529: $$
530: dx_i = v_i dt
531: $$
532: 
533: $$
534: dv_i = -\gamma v_i dt + F_i dt + \sqrt{2D} dW_i
535: $$
536: 
537: where $F_i$ includes confining force, adaptive force, and viscous force.
538: 
539: The fitness change for a single walker (no cloning) is:
540: 
541: $$
542: \Delta \Phi_i = \Phi(x_i(t+\Delta t)) - \Phi(x_i(t)) = \nabla \Phi(x_i) \cdot \Delta x_i + O(\Delta t^2)
543: $$
544: 
545: $$
546: = \nabla \Phi(x_i) \cdot v_i \Delta t + O(\Delta t^2)
547: $$
548: 
549: **Step 3: Spatial divergence term.**
550: 
551: Using the definition $J^k = \rho_{\text{fitness}} v^k = \Phi(x_i) v_i^k$:
552: 
553: $$
554: \Delta \Phi_i = \sum_{k=1}^d \frac{\partial \Phi}{\partial x^k} v_i^k \Delta t = \sum_k \frac{\partial J^k}{\partial x^k} \Big|_{x=x_i} \Delta t + O(\Delta t^2)
555: $$
556: 
557: **Step 4: Source terms from cloning.**
558: 
559: At cloning events:
560: - **Birth** (new walker $j$ created): $\Delta Q = +\Phi(x_j)$
561: - **Death** (walker $i$ exits): $\Delta Q = -\Phi(x_i)$
562: 
563: Define the source term:
564: 
565: $$
566: \mathcal{S}_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t}) \Delta t := \begin{cases}
567: +\Phi(x_j) & \text{if walker } j \text{ born at node } n_{j,t} \\
568: -\Phi(x_i) & \text{if walker } i \text{ dies at node } n_{i,t} \\
569: 0 & \text{otherwise}
570: \end{cases}
571: $$
572: 
573: **Step 5: Discrete continuity equation.**
574: 
575: Combining Steps 2-4 for each walker:
576: 
577: $$
578: \frac{\Phi(x_i(t+\Delta t)) - \Phi(x_i(t))}{\Delta t} = -\sum_{k=1}^d \partial_k J^k_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t}) + \mathcal{S}_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t}) + O(\Delta t)
579: $$
580: 
581: Since $J^0_{\text{fitness}} = \rho_{\text{fitness}} = \Phi(x_i)$ (non-relativistic), the left side is $\partial_0 J^0$.
582: 
583: Therefore:
584: 
585: $$
586: \partial_0 J^0_{\text{fitness}} + \nabla \cdot \mathbf{J}_{\text{fitness}} = \mathcal{S}_{\text{fitness}}
587: $$
588: 
589: **Step 6: Global conservation.**
590: 
591: Summing over all walkers and integrating over space:
592: 
593: $$
594: \frac{d}{dt} \sum_{i \in A_t} \Phi(x_i) = \sum_{i \in A_t} \mathcal{S}_{\text{fitness}}(n_{i,t})
595: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-157
hints.title: Comparison to Baryon Number Conservation
hints.content:
601: :class: tip
602: 
603: In QCD, baryon number $B$ is globally conserved with current:
604: 
605: $$
606: J_B^\mu = \sum_{\text{quarks}} \bar{q} \gamma^\mu q
607: $$
608: 
609: Our fitness current is precisely analogous:
610: 
611: | **QCD** | **Adaptive Gas** |
612: |---------|------------------|
613: | Baryon current $J_B^\mu$ | Fitness current $J_{\text{fitness}}^\mu$ |
614: | Quark fields $q$ | Walker fitness $\Phi(x_i)$ |
615: | Baryon charge $B = \int J_B^0 d^3x$ | Total fitness $Q = \sum_i \Phi(x_i)$ |

hints.label: thm-su2-noether-current
hints.title: SU(2) Weak Isospin Noether Current
hints.content:
623: :label: thm-su2-noether-current
624: 
625: The local SU(2)_weak gauge symmetry implies three conserved weak isospin currents, one for each generator $T^a = \sigma^a/2$ ($a = 1,2,3$).
626: 
627: **1. Current Definition:**
628: 
629: For each cloning pair $(i,j)$ with interaction state $|\Psi_{ij}\rangle \in \mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}$, define the **weak isospin 4-current**:
630: 
631: $$
632: J_\mu^{(a)}(i,j) = \bar{\Psi}_{ij} \gamma_\mu (T^a \otimes I_{\text{div}}) \Psi_{ij}
633: $$
634: 
635: where:
636: - $\Psi_{ij} = |↑\rangle \otimes |\psi_i\rangle + |↓\rangle \otimes |\psi_j\rangle$: interaction doublet
637: - $\gamma_\mu$: Dirac gamma matrices in $(1+d)$ dimensions
638: - $T^a = \sigma^a/2$: Pauli matrices (SU(2) generators acting on isospin space)
639: - $I_{\text{div}}$: identity on diversity space $\mathbb{C}^{N-1}$
640: - $\bar{\Psi}_{ij} = \Psi_{ij}^\dagger \gamma^0$: Dirac adjoint
641: 
642: **2. Explicit Component Form:**
643: 
644: Writing out the tensor product structure:
645: 
646: $$
647: J_\mu^{(a)}(i,j) = \langle ↑| \otimes \langle \psi_i| + \langle ↓| \otimes \langle \psi_j| \Big) \gamma_\mu (T^a \otimes I) \Big(|↑\rangle \otimes |\psi_i\rangle + |↓\rangle \otimes |\psi_j\rangle \Big)
648: $$
649: 
650: For $a=3$ (diagonal generator $T^3 = \text{diag}(1/2, -1/2)$):
651: 
652: $$
653: J_\mu^{(3)}(i,j) = \frac{1}{2} \bar{\psi}_i \gamma_\mu \psi_i - \frac{1}{2} \bar{\psi}_j \gamma_\mu \psi_j
654: $$
655: 
656: This is the **isospin charge difference** between cloner and target.
657: 
658: For $a=1,2$ (off-diagonal generators):
659: 
660: $$
661: J_\mu^{(1,2)}(i,j) \propto \bar{\psi}_i \gamma_\mu \psi_j + \bar{\psi}_j \gamma_\mu \psi_i
662: $$
663: 
664: These are **mixing currents** coupling the two dressed walker states.
665: 
666: **3. Conservation Law:**
667: 
668: Assuming the effective Lagrangian ({prf:ref}`def-effective-matter-lagrangian`) governs the dynamics, the current satisfies:
669: 
670: $$
671: \partial^\mu J_\mu^{(a)}(i,j) = 0
672: $$
673: 
674: (discrete divergence vanishes on-shell, i.e., when equations of motion are satisfied).
675: 
676: **4. Gauge Transformation:**
677: 
678: Under local SU(2) transformation $U_i, U_j \in \text{SU}(2)$ at nodes $i$ and $j$:
679: 
680: $$
681: J_\mu^{(a)} \to (U_i)_{ab} J_\mu^{(b)} (U_j^\dagger)_{bc}
682: $$
683: 
684: (adjoint representation transformation).
685: 
686: **Physical observables** are traces:
687: 
688: $$
689: \mathcal{O}_{\text{weak}} = \sum_{a=1}^3 \text{Tr}(J_\mu^{(a)} J^{(a),\mu})
690: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-252
hints.content:
694: 
695: :::{prf:proof}
696: **Step 1: SU(2) symmetry of effective Lagrangian.**
697: 
698: The effective Lagrangian ({prf:ref}`def-effective-matter-lagrangian`) is:
699: 
700: $$
701: \mathcal{L}_{\text{matter}} = \bar{\Psi}_{ij} (i\gamma^\mu \partial_\mu - m_{\text{eff}}) \Psi_{ij}
702: $$
703: 
704: **Claim**: This is invariant under SU(2) transformations $(U \otimes I_{\text{div}})$ acting on $\Psi_{ij}$.
705: 
706: **Verification**:
707: - Kinetic term: $\bar{\Psi}_{ij} \gamma^\mu \partial_\mu \Psi_{ij}$ is a scalar under $\text{SU}(2) \otimes \text{Id}$
708: - Mass term: $m_{\text{eff}} = \langle \Psi_{ij} | \hat{S}_{ij} | \Psi_{ij} \rangle$ where $\hat{S}_{ij} = (\hat{P}_\uparrow \otimes \hat{V}_i) - (\hat{P}_\downarrow \otimes \hat{V}_j)$
709: 
710: Under $\Psi \to (U \otimes I) \Psi$:
711: 
712: $$
713: \langle \Psi' | \hat{S}_{ij} | \Psi' \rangle = \langle \Psi | (U^\dagger \otimes I) \hat{S}_{ij} (U \otimes I) | \Psi \rangle
714: $$
715: 
716: For $U \in \text{SU}(2)$:
717: 
718: $$
719: U^\dagger \hat{P}_\uparrow U = \text{(rotated projector in isospin space)}
720: $$
721: 
722: The key is that **$\hat{S}_{ij}$ is not SU(2)-invariant individually**, but the **dynamics** preserve the total interaction probability ({prf:ref}`prop-su2-invariance`).
723: 
724: **Correction**: The Lagrangian as written is not fully SU(2)-invariant because $m_{\text{eff}}$ depends on the isospin projectors. For a true SU(2)-invariant theory, we would need:
725: 
726: $$
727: \mathcal{L} = \bar{\Psi} i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \Psi - m_0 \bar{\Psi}\Psi
728: $$
729: 
730: with gauge-covariant derivative $D_\mu$ and **constant mass** $m_0$.
731: 
732: **Resolution**: The effective Lagrangian is an approximation valid when the SU(2) gauge field is weak. The fitness-dependent mass $m_{\text{eff}}$ breaks exact SU(2) invariance, but the **total interaction probability remains invariant** ({prf:ref}`prop-su2-invariance`).
733: 
734: **Step 2: Noether current from global SU(2) (formal derivation).**
735: 
736: For pedagogical purposes, consider a **global** SU(2) transformation (same $U$ at all nodes). The infinitesimal generator is:
737: 
738: $$
739: \delta_a \Psi_{ij} = i\epsilon^a (T^a \otimes I_{\text{div}}) \Psi_{ij}
740: $$
741: 
742: By Noether's theorem ({prf:ref}`thm-noether-adaptive` in {doc}`09_symmetries_adaptive_gas.md`), the conserved current is:
743: 
744: $$
745: J_\mu^{(a)} = \frac{\partial \mathcal{L}}{\partial(\partial_\mu \Psi)} \cdot (\delta_a \Psi) = \bar{\Psi}_{ij} \gamma_\mu (T^a \otimes I_{\text{div}}) \Psi_{ij}
746: $$
747: 
748: **Step 3: Conservation law (formal).**
749: 
750: Using the Euler-Lagrange equations (Dirac equation):
751: 
752: $$
753: (i\gamma^\mu \partial_\mu - m_{\text{eff}}) \Psi_{ij} = 0
754: $$
755: 
756: and its adjoint:
757: 
758: $$
759: \bar{\Psi}_{ij} (i\gamma^\mu \overleftarrow{\partial}_\mu + m_{\text{eff}}) = 0
760: $$
761: 
762: we compute:
763: 
764: $$
765: \partial^\mu J_\mu^{(a)} = \partial^\mu (\bar{\Psi} \gamma_\mu T^a \Psi) = (\partial^\mu \bar{\Psi}) \gamma_\mu T^a \Psi + \bar{\Psi} \gamma_\mu T^a (\partial^\mu \Psi)
766: $$
767: 
768: Using the Dirac equations:
769: 
770: $$
771: = \bar{\Psi} \{[m_{\text{eff}}, T^a]\} \Psi
772: $$
773: 
774: If $m_{\text{eff}}$ commutes with $T^a$ (i.e., is an SU(2) singlet), then:
775: 
776: $$
777: \partial^\mu J_\mu^{(a)} = 0
778: $$
779: 
780: **Step 4: Caveat on effective mass.**
781: 
782: In our model, $m_{\text{eff}} = \langle \Psi | \hat{S}_{ij} | \Psi \rangle$ is **state-dependent** and does not commute with $T^a$ in general. Therefore, the current is only **approximately conserved** when fitness variations are small.
hints.raw_directive:
693: :::
694: 
695: :::{prf:proof}
696: **Step 1: SU(2) symmetry of effective Lagrangian.**
697: 
698: The effective Lagrangian ({prf:ref}`def-effective-matter-lagrangian`) is:
699: 
700: $$
701: \mathcal{L}_{\text{matter}} = \bar{\Psi}_{ij} (i\gamma^\mu \partial_\mu - m_{\text{eff}}) \Psi_{ij}
702: $$
703: 
704: **Claim**: This is invariant under SU(2) transformations $(U \otimes I_{\text{div}})$ acting on $\Psi_{ij}$.
705: 
706: **Verification**:
707: - Kinetic term: $\bar{\Psi}_{ij} \gamma^\mu \partial_\mu \Psi_{ij}$ is a scalar under $\text{SU}(2) \otimes \text{Id}$
708: - Mass term: $m_{\text{eff}} = \langle \Psi_{ij} | \hat{S}_{ij} | \Psi_{ij} \rangle$ where $\hat{S}_{ij} = (\hat{P}_\uparrow \otimes \hat{V}_i) - (\hat{P}_\downarrow \otimes \hat{V}_j)$
709: 
710: Under $\Psi \to (U \otimes I) \Psi$:
711: 
712: $$
713: \langle \Psi' | \hat{S}_{ij} | \Psi' \rangle = \langle \Psi | (U^\dagger \otimes I) \hat{S}_{ij} (U \otimes I) | \Psi \rangle
714: $$
715: 
716: For $U \in \text{SU}(2)$:
717: 
718: $$
719: U^\dagger \hat{P}_\uparrow U = \text{(rotated projector in isospin space)}
720: $$
721: 
722: The key is that **$\hat{S}_{ij}$ is not SU(2)-invariant individually**, but the **dynamics** preserve the total interaction probability ({prf:ref}`prop-su2-invariance`).
723: 
724: **Correction**: The Lagrangian as written is not fully SU(2)-invariant because $m_{\text{eff}}$ depends on the isospin projectors. For a true SU(2)-invariant theory, we would need:
725: 
726: $$
727: \mathcal{L} = \bar{\Psi} i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \Psi - m_0 \bar{\Psi}\Psi
728: $$
729: 
730: with gauge-covariant derivative $D_\mu$ and **constant mass** $m_0$.
731: 
732: **Resolution**: The effective Lagrangian is an approximation valid when the SU(2) gauge field is weak. The fitness-dependent mass $m_{\text{eff}}$ breaks exact SU(2) invariance, but the **total interaction probability remains invariant** ({prf:ref}`prop-su2-invariance`).
733: 
734: **Step 2: Noether current from global SU(2) (formal derivation).**
735: 
736: For pedagogical purposes, consider a **global** SU(2) transformation (same $U$ at all nodes). The infinitesimal generator is:
737: 
738: $$
739: \delta_a \Psi_{ij} = i\epsilon^a (T^a \otimes I_{\text{div}}) \Psi_{ij}
740: $$
741: 
742: By Noether's theorem ({prf:ref}`thm-noether-adaptive` in {doc}`09_symmetries_adaptive_gas.md`), the conserved current is:
743: 
744: $$
745: J_\mu^{(a)} = \frac{\partial \mathcal{L}}{\partial(\partial_\mu \Psi)} \cdot (\delta_a \Psi) = \bar{\Psi}_{ij} \gamma_\mu (T^a \otimes I_{\text{div}}) \Psi_{ij}
746: $$
747: 
748: **Step 3: Conservation law (formal).**
749: 
750: Using the Euler-Lagrange equations (Dirac equation):
751: 
752: $$
753: (i\gamma^\mu \partial_\mu - m_{\text{eff}}) \Psi_{ij} = 0
754: $$
755: 
756: and its adjoint:
757: 
758: $$
759: \bar{\Psi}_{ij} (i\gamma^\mu \overleftarrow{\partial}_\mu + m_{\text{eff}}) = 0
760: $$
761: 
762: we compute:
763: 
764: $$
765: \partial^\mu J_\mu^{(a)} = \partial^\mu (\bar{\Psi} \gamma_\mu T^a \Psi) = (\partial^\mu \bar{\Psi}) \gamma_\mu T^a \Psi + \bar{\Psi} \gamma_\mu T^a (\partial^\mu \Psi)
766: $$
767: 
768: Using the Dirac equations:
769: 
770: $$
771: = \bar{\Psi} \{[m_{\text{eff}}, T^a]\} \Psi
772: $$
773: 
774: If $m_{\text{eff}}$ commutes with $T^a$ (i.e., is an SU(2) singlet), then:
775: 
776: $$
777: \partial^\mu J_\mu^{(a)} = 0
778: $$
779: 
780: **Step 4: Caveat on effective mass.**
781: 
782: In our model, $m_{\text{eff}} = \langle \Psi | \hat{S}_{ij} | \Psi \rangle$ is **state-dependent** and does not commute with $T^a$ in general. Therefore, the current is only **approximately conserved** when fitness variations are small.

hints.title: Limitations of Effective Field Theory
hints.content:
788: :class: warning
789: 
790: The SU(2) current conservation is **approximate** in our effective model because:
791: 
792: 1. The fitness-dependent mass $m_{\text{eff}}$ breaks exact SU(2) invariance
793: 2. The Lagrangian is postulated, not derived from first principles
794: 3. The true gauge-invariant observable is the **total interaction probability**, not individual currents
795: 
796: Despite these limitations, the effective field theory framework provides:
797: - A systematic way to organize symmetries
798: - Correct gauge-invariant observables ({prf:ref}`prop-su2-invariance`)
799: - A bridge to lattice gauge theory formulation
